channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OR

item.title: Report X-2024021377
item.description:
Report X-2024021377

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-10
  • City: SALEM
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: diver removed package from vehicle due to leakage and placed in plastic bag on dock. DescribePack: loose cap on 1 gal bottle with 64 oz leaked out DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: HazMat was bagged and placed in damaged package tote.

item.title: Report X-2024021563
item.description:
Report X-2024021563

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-20
  • City: HILLSBORO
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A WET PACKAGE THAT NEEDED TO BE REWRAPPED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED FIFTEEN DEVICES CONTAINING LITHIUM ION BATTERIES. AT LEAST ONE APPEARS VISIBLY WARPED OR DAMAGED. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED NEXT DAY AIR FROM OKLAHOMA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER HH8169, GROVE TECHNOLOGY SERVICES LLC, 2230 PACIFIC AVE., FOREST GROVE OR 97116-2448.

item.title: Report X-2024021304
item.description:
Report X-2024021304

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-01
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: CALL MADE TO PSC FOR CLEAN UP. RESPONDER WENT TO SPILL FOLLOWED SMALL PACKAGE DECISON TREE AND DONNED PPE. SPILL WAS CLEAND UP AND PACKAGE / DEBRIS WAS BROUGHT TO THE PSC FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON OPENING BOX 3 AEROSOL CANS WERE DISCOVERD CALL MADE TO HMSC THAT TOLD US TO HOLD THEM FOR ADG.

item.title: Report X-2024021455
item.description:
Report X-2024021455

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-16
  • City: THE DALLES
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was seen to have visible staining and odor by ISP employee. ISP employee notified station management of a leaking hazmat. Station management took lined tote to the area along with PPE and contained the leaking product. No visible "leak trail" could be seen and it looked to be inactively leaking during transit from the trailer to the final location. DescribePack: 3 of the 4 one gallon containers had loose caps. 1 of the 4 gallon containers had a damage protective seal, under the cap, allowing content to leak. DurationRel: 7 and MitigateEffect: Package was isolated in a lined hazmat tote.

item.title: Report X-2024021323
item.description:
Report X-2024021323

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-05T00:31:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-23
  • City: TROUTDALE
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A bottle of wheel and tire cleaner with no cap, leaked inside of the package causing outer packaging to fail. And that led to the discovery of the undeclared HAZMATs inside the packag. No leakage from the HAZMAT its self. DescribePack: Two sides of the package fell apart due to internal leakage, causing the sides of the package to disintegrate. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: No actions were needed.
